documents.content: International Students Office: Located at Faculty of Communications 2nd Floor. Handles all matters regarding international students including registration, accounting, graduation and student permits. Working hours: Monday to Friday 8am to 5pm, closed during holidays.
Grand Library: Near East University Grand Library is open Monday to Friday from 8am to 8pm. The library provides study spaces, resources, and academic materials for students.

Student Deanship Office: Located at Ataturk Culture and Congress Center. The Dean of Students Office provides services, programs, and various opportunities to students. Contact: neuogrenci.dekanligi@neu.edu.tr, Phone: +90 (392) 223 64 64
Near East University Hospital: Full-service hospital facility on campus providing medical care to students and the community.
Near East Bank: Banking services available on campus for student convenience.
Main Campus Address: Near East University, Near East Boulevard, 99138 Nicosia / TRNC, Mersin 10 – TURKEY
Application Process: Students can apply online at https://aday.neu.edu.tr. The application system is available for all prospective students.

Accepted Certificates - International Exams: NEU accepts: GCSE, IGCSE, International Baccalaureate, ACT, SAT, and various international high school diplomas. All documents in languages other than English or Turkish require official translation.

Accepted Certificates - Regional Exams: NEU accepts: Tawjihi (Jordan/Palestine), Baccalaureate (Lebanon/Iraq/Syria), Diploma Debirestan (Iran), Higher Secondary Certificate (Pakistan/India/Bangladesh), WAEC/NECO (Nigeria), GAOKAO (China), and other High School Diplomas.
Student Residence Permit: International students must register for residence permit at https://permissions.gov.ct.tr/login. The International Students Office assists with this process.
Tuition Fees 2025-2026: Full list of programs and tuition fees available at https://aday.neu.edu.tr. Fees vary by program and faculty.
Document Translation: All documents submitted in languages other than English or Turkish must have an official translation.
ES - Atatürk Faculty of Education: Offers education and teaching programs preparing students for careers in education.. Prerequisites: None. Credits: null
INV - Faculty of Engineering: Comprehensive engineering programs covering various engineering disciplines.. Prerequisites: None. Credits: null
- Faculty of Medicine: Medical education and training programs for aspiring doctors and healthcare professionals.. Prerequisites: None. Credits: null
- Faculty of Dentistry: Dental education programs preparing students for careers in dentistry.. Prerequisites: None. Credits: null
ECZ - Faculty of Pharmacy: Pharmaceutical sciences programs for future pharmacists.. Prerequisites: None. Credits: null
FE - Faculty of Arts and Sciences: Liberal arts and sciences programs offering diverse academic disciplines.. Prerequisites: None. Credits: null
II - Faculty of Economics and Administrative Sciences: Business, economics, and administrative programs preparing students for careers in business and management.. Prerequisites: None. Credits: null

IL - Faculty of Communication: Communication, journalism, and media studies programs.. Prerequisites: None. Credits: null
INV - Faculty of Artificial Intelligence and Informatics: AI, computer science, and information technology programs for the digital age.. Prerequisites: None. Credits: null

documents.content: - Faculty of Fine Arts and Design: Arts, design, and creative programs for aspiring artists and designers.. Prerequisites: None. Credits: null

metadata.title: Faculty of Fine Arts and Design

documents.content: What is Near East University's contact information?: Phone: +90 (392) 223 64 64 or +90 (392) 680 20 00. Email: info@neu.edu.tr. WhatsApp: +90 548 818 0818. Extension: 5143. Address: Near East Boulevard, 99138 Nicosia / TRNC, Mersin 10 – TURKEY.

metadata.title: What is Near East University's contact information?

documents.content: What is the official website?: The official website is https://neu.edu.tr where you can find comprehensive information about the university.
What are the Grand Library hours?: The Grand Library is open Monday to Friday from 8am to 8pm. It provides study spaces, resources, and academic materials.

metadata.title: What are the Grand Library hours?

documents.content: Where is the International Students Office?: The International Students Office is located on the 2nd floor of the Faculty of Communications building. They are open Monday to Friday, 8am to 5pm, and closed during holidays.

metadata.title: Where is the International Students Office?

documents.content: How can I submit petitions?: Students can submit petitions regarding refunds, academic matters, job applications, dormitory matters, and financial matters through the online petition system at petitions@neu.edu.tr.

Is psychological counseling available?: Yes, NEU provides psychological counseling services through the Psychological Counseling, Guidance, and Research Center. Students can contact them at pdram@neu.edu.tr or through the Dean of Students' Office.

What student clubs and activities are available?: The Student Activities Center helps organize events and directs students to clubs and societies. They also represent students in domestic and international events. Contact: yduodkulupleri@neu.edu.tr

metadata.title: What student clubs and activities are available?

documents.content: Where can I find the academic calendar?: The 2025-2026 academic calendar is available at https://neu.edu.tr/academic/academic-calendar

metadata.title: Where can I find the academic calendar?

documents.content: Where can I find the university handbook?: The university handbook is available online at https://online.fliphtml5.com/mabep/cfjs/#p=37

metadata.title: Where can I find the university handbook?

documents.content: What faculties does NEU have?: NEU has 20 faculties including: Education, Engineering, Medicine, Dentistry, Pharmacy, Arts and Sciences, Economics, Law, Architecture, Communication, AI and Informatics, Fine Arts and Design, Nursing, Civil Engineering, Theology, Health Sciences, Sports Sciences, Tourism, Veterinary Medicine, and Agriculture.

What services does the Dean of Students Office provide?: The Dean of Students Office provides counseling, student activities, career planning, social responsibility projects, disability support, and alumni services. They also handle student petitions and various student affairs.

metadata.title: What services does the Dean of Students Office provide?

documents.content: What facilities are available on campus?: Campus facilities include: Grand Library, Near East University Hospital, Near East Bank, International Students Office, Student Deanship Office, and various faculty buildings. The university also features Dorana Tourism and Günsel Electric Vehicle facilities.

metadata.title: What facilities are available on campus?

documents.content: How do I contact the Student Deanship?: Email: neuogrenci.dekanligi@neu.edu.tr or yduodkulupleri@neu.edu.tr. Phone: +90 (392) 223 64 64, +90 (392) 680 20 00, or +90 (392) 223 64 61. Located at Ataturk Culture and Congress Center.

metadata.title: How do I contact the Student Deanship?

documents.content: What career services are available?: NEU has a Career Planning Unit under the Dean of Students Office that provides career counseling and planning services to help students prepare for their professional futures.
Are there services for disabled students?: Yes, the Disabled Students Unit under the Dean of Students Office provides support and accommodations for students with disabilities.

metadata.title: Are there services for disabled students?
